title: Max Holloway criticizes Conor McGregor for lacking focus
text:
As things currently stand, UFC featherweight champion Max Holloway isn’t interested in a rematch with Conor McGregor.

On Monday, Holloway said McGregor has lost focus and would only be willing to fight him if he’s as motivated as he was when he held two UFC championships simultaneously.

“When Conor beat Aldo in December 2015 and when he beat Eddie in November 2016, for those 12 months, he ruled the world,” Holloway said during an appearance on “Ariel Helwani’s MMA Show.” “The world. Not just the UFC, the world. And the one thing I can remember and take away from that time was his focus. He was so focused. He decided what he wanted, and he said stuff, he pointed at this guy, he reached for the stars, he reached for the moon, and he made it happen. Magical.”

McGregor defeated Holloway via unanimous decision in 2013 in what was only McGregor’s second UFC fight; Holloway was just 22 at the time. In a recent interview with ESPN, McGregor took several jabs at Holloway and said he’d be willing to fight him, as well as Frankie Edgar and a few others.

But Holloway doesn’t believe McGregor, who’s only competed in MMA once in almost 3 years, even knows what he wants next.

“Listening to him now, I don’t see that same focus,” Holloway said. “If you’re going after everything, you’re not focused on anything. He called out like 20 guys in that interview.”

Holloway attempted to capture the interim lightweight title earlier this year but fell short to Dustin Poirier at UFC 236. It’s no secret that his cut down to featherweight is tough, but Holloway, who recently notched his second title defense in a win over Edgar, is still very much focused on 145-pounds.

He takes on Alexander Volkanovski at UFC 245 on Dec. 14 and should he cross paths with McGregor in the future, he wants to compete with the best version of him possible.

“I’m not interested in competing with him if he’s not at his best,” Holloway said. “And he doesn’t seem healthy, and he doesn’t sound right. If he comes back and he says, ‘Hey, I beat Max when he was a kid, but I want to beat him in his prime to prove that I’m the best ever,’ then yeah I want the champ. I want that champ. I want that 2015-2016 champ. That mentality and that focus, and right now it’s just not interesting to me.

“I want to fight the best Conor McGregor. So he can go figure things out, and he can let us know.”
description: Max Holloway would only want to fight Conor McGregor again if he's focused and at his best: "I want that 2015-2016 champ."
